quote: We all want to feel like the most beautiful girl in the room, to be chosen and loved forever. The Cinderella story gives us hope of our impossible dreams becoming true.

quote: I think there are some who live on a knife-edge in the soul, and at times are driven to hurl themselves into the air, at the mercy of heaven or he'll which way to fall.
author: Ellis Peters, A Morbid Taste for Bones

quote: Remember that sometimes you find your destiny in the places you least expect it.
author: Sarah Holman, The Destiny of One

quote: Nothing in life is a foregone conclusion unless and until it is foregone and concluded

quote: I believe that purpose is not only a destination but it is the energy that pushes us toward its fulfillment.

quote: In the path of our happiness shall we find the learning for which we have chosen this lifetime.

quote: If life's journey was intended to be easy, we would have been given directions. However, since we have no road map, we must climb the highest mountain and forge the deepest streams with love in our souls, in the hope that our own journey will give us peace within...

quote: Like Artemis and Orion, fate was working against us, and we couldn't be together in this life. But he will forever be immortalized in my heart.

quote: Your opinions about doesn't matter, I know who I am.

quote: It’s too late for you Wilhelmina Grimm, great great great granddaughter of Wilhelm Grimm.

quote: There's a time when a man needs to fight and a time when he needs to accept that his destiny's lost, the ship has sailed and that only a fool will continue. The truth is I've always been a fool.

quote: When the filly, the maiden, the boy and the warrior are ready to take up their Destinies, each will know it. The filly will become a mare, the maiden a woman, the boy a man. The Warrior, however, will pick up a stick and walk from his mother, his people, and his land, and never once remove his eyes from the true red road that lies beneath his feet. And yet, he will never know that he is on his Path. (From Brothers of Light)
author: Stan Sudan, Sisters of Light

quote: Only fate would decree how it reached its destiny, which always waited just around the corner, over the hill...
author: Virginia Alison

quote: Insanity, thy name is woman
author: Virginia Alison, Heaven Scent

quote: You can no more look destiny in the face than you can look at the sun, and yet destiny is grey
author: Henri Barbusse

quote: Love is waiting, just around the corner, over the hill...
author: Virginia Alison

quote: Grace: All that I am and will be.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: believers, believers-in-god, destiny, divine-favour, divine-grace, faith, faith-in-god, faith-quotes, god, journey-quotes, religion-christianity, religious-faith, spiritual, spiritual-quotes, spirituality, spirituality-vs-religion

quote: Fate is a given, destiny is what we do with it
author: Shavasti, Embracing the Power of Truth

quote: Destiny was funny stuff, he knew. You couldn’t trust it. Often you couldn’t even see it. Just when you knew you had it cornered, it turned out to be something else—coincidence, maybe, or providence. You barred the door against it, and it was standing behind you. Then just when you thought you had it nailed down it walked away with the hammer.
author: Terry Pratchett, Wyrd Sisters

quote: Destiny is no more than the fulfillment of purposive potentialities within us. The human cerebral cortex is a single sheet composed of more neurons than there are stars in the known universe folded like a paper crane to fit in a quart-sized cubbyhole
author: there is enough potential energy in a single person that if released would equal thirty hydrogen bombs. Destiny is nothing to sneeze at!

quote: Let me here remind you that the essence of dramatic tragedy is not unhappiness. It resides in the solemnity of the remorseless working of things. This inevitableness of destiny can only be illustrated in terms of human life by incidents which in fact involve unhappiness. For it is by them that the futility of escape can be made evident in the drama. This remorseless inevitableness is what pervades scientific thought. The laws of physics are the decrees of fate.
author: Alfred North Whitehead
category: destiny, drama, fate, philosophy, physics, science, tragedy

quote: This was her destiny, and it was a fit and proper one. She was not unwilling, but she knew this was a fateful moment, and she had a sense of doors closing behind her and the path of her life being fixed irrevocably.
author: Ken Follett, The Pillars of the Earth

quote: ...our ability to achieve our dreams and fulfill our destiny is directly influenced by our thinking. How we think determines our responses, our ability to relate to others, our level of commitment, our priorities, and the dreams we will pursue.
author: Christine Caine

quote: Sometimes our fate – our destiny turns out to be something we had never thought of.
author: Waheed Ibne Musa, Johnny Fracture

quote: God gave us imaginations because he wants us to see the photos of our destinies respectively and make proper graphical designs of them. You owe it to yourself to enlarge that image you carry into bigger sizes.

quote: In business, ruthlessness is righteousness.Seldom are there those, whom are ruthlessly righteous.Listen to these people, before the Earth repents of mankind.
author: Justin K. McFarlane Beau
category: business, destiny, earth, mankind, prophecy, rare, repentance, righteousness, ruthless, seldom, univers

quote: She shook her head in perplexity. "I'll never know where you got the idea that you were destined for greatness." She dropped the rest of the rabbit in the pot and begun to clean the underside of its skin. She would use the fur. "You certainly didn't inherit it from your forebears.
author: Ken Follett, The Pillars of the Earth

quote: If you don't know who you are, you will never know what belongs to you!
author: Gail Hayes

quote: We appealed to the conscience of the world. The world has no conscience. We have no one but ourselves."The fight. The struggle. The historic destiny. The return of the people. The cause: life therefore having a meaning and shape that eludes the rest of us in the endless wash of 'What the hell are we doing here?' In a single day, says an Israeli friend, he experiences events and emotions that would keep a Swede going for a year.
author: David Hare, Via Dolorosa & When Shall We Live?

quote: You are today where your decisions have brought you; you will be tomorrow where your decisions will take you. If you really want to know who you are now, take a tour about the decisions you made some years back.
author: Israelmore Ayivor, Dream Big!: See Your Bigger Picture!
category: actions, choice, choose, chosen, decide, decisions, destiny, food-for-thought, israelmore-ayivor, today, tomorrow

quote: This is my calling.This is my destiny.I am living my dreams.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: calling-dreams, destiny, dream-big, dreams-quotes, your-destiny, your-journey, your-life

quote: Every woman is called to lead somebody somewhere to do something great!

quote: I don’t think I believe in any god,” Merla said. “I think we make our own destiny. I think religion is superstition. Does that shock you?”Agata shook her head and smiled. “If the Goddess is kind, then she will allow you your doubts, and embrace believers and unbelievers alike. If she is not, then the witches are mistaken, and we should not be worshipping her anyway.
author: Duncan Harper, Witch of the Fall

quote: 105If you don't know who you are, you will never know what belongs to you!
author: Gail Hayes

quote: I’ve learned that you cannot fulfill your destiny if you’re not being yourself; you can’t fulfill your destiny, trying to be somebody else. We are created unique not so that we can fit in, but so that we can stand out.
author: Jeanette Coron

quote: Fulfilling our destiny and realizing our potential all begins in our mind. That's why the devil tries to bombard our thinking.
author: Christine Caine

quote: Keep encouraging yourself that you are good enough as a workman of God created for every good work one earth prepared for you before the world begun.

quote: Don't name our stupidity, ignorance, stupid rules and lack of skills DESTINY!
author: Maliheh Sadat Razavi

quote: Drive your life with care. Look nowhere else than up to your long cherished destination. You can only get there with focus. Blind your eyes from anything else!

quote: Be the author, not the reader, of your own life.
author: Paul Gibbons, Reboot Your Life: A 12-day Program for Ending Stress, Realizing Your Goals, and Being More Productive

quote: The beauty of traveling solo is that you wonder unexpectedly, but almost certainly into the direction you were meant to go.
author: Shannon Ables

quote: Satan knows, if you are against YOURSELF you will never fulfill your destiny. :(
author: Joel Osteen

quote: To be in between the two things you love is difficult.Somewhat, destiny comes and helps you choose

quote: Nothing exists without a purpose. Every experience you have in this lifetime was written for you to grow into the light you were meant to be.
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
category: destiny, inspiration, life, light, purpose, quotes, suzy-kassem

quote: The sword of destiny has two edges. You are one of them.
author: Andrzej Sapkowski

quote: An enlightened man had but one duty--to seek the way to himself, to reach inner certainty, to grope his way forward, no matter where it led. The realization shook me profoundly, it was the fruit of this experience. I had often speculated with images of the future, dreamed of roles that I might be assigned, perhaps as poet or prophet or painter, or something similar. 	All that was futile. I did not exist to write poems, to preach or to paint, neither I nor anyone else. All of that was incidental. Each man had only one genuine vocation--to find the way to himself. He might end up as poet or madman, as prophet or criminal--that was not his affair, ultimately it was of no concern. His task was to discover his own destiny--not an arbitrary one--and live it out wholly and resolutely within himself. Everything else was only a would-be existence, an attempt at evasion, aflight back to the ideals of the masses, conformity and fear of one's own inwardness.
author: Hermann Hesse
category: demian, destiny, enlightement, hesse, jobs, men, occupation

quote: Fate was tricky like that. It consumed us when we thought we were free, and it freed us when we thought we were captured.
author: Shannon A. Thompson, Death Before Daylight
category: captured, destined-love, destiny, fate, fated-love, fighting-fate, love, love-quote, stuck, true-love, young-love

quote: The future is certain. It is just not known.

category: certain, certainty, destiny, determinism, fatalism, fate, future, inevitability, knowable, predeterminism, predictability, probability, uncertainty

quote: Names are powerful and so is destiny, but a person's will is more powerful than both put together.

quote: In every moment of choice, you create a new destiny.

category: ambition, choice, decision, decision-making, decisions, destiny, goals, journey-quotes, many-worlds, many-worlds-interpretation, path-of-life, purpose, success, winning

quote: They have cast my life like dice, in a game that is not a game. The unusual erupted into my life like a storm; I mean unusual in my actual perception of things. Do not mistake me; I never desired things that are certainly harder to bear, and nobody asked me if I really wanted an extraordinary life. That is not entirely true; I was asked, in the way a child seeing a cake is asked if he really wants to eat it.
author: Florian Armas, Io Deceneus: Journal of a Time Traveler

quote: Maybe destiny isn't something that just happens. Maybe destiny is something you do. Maybe destiny is like a seed and it grows.
author: Liesl Shurtliff, Rump: The True Story of Rumpelstiltskin

quote: God has a plan for everyone he created and none of his creations is meant to be purposeless. Every human being for that matter was brought forth with a specific and unique duty to uptake while he lives on earth.

category: creations, creator, destiny, earth, food-for-thought, god, human-being, israelmore-ayivor, jehovah, mission, plan, purpose, purposeful, unique

quote: Every event in life — the rejections, the relationships, all the embarrassing things you do will lead you to the person you are destined to be with. You may want to change certain things about your past, but everything has been just another chapter in your book of life. If you don’t believe me, buy a book — any book — and rip out an entire chapter — any chapter — and read it. Now, get a full copy of the same book and read it again. Odds are you’ll find that chapter pieced everything together the way it was supposed to be.
author: Mike Zacchio
category: books, chapters, destiny, fate, life-lessons, life-quotes, purpose, romance, soulmates, true-love

quote: Don’t panic, you are never alone in building up your dreams. The storehouse of your success was built by the very supreme father who created it for you.
author: Israelmore Ayivor, Dream Big!: See Your Bigger Picture!
category: big-dreams, destiny, dream-big, dreams, fear, food-for-thought, frighten, israelmore-ayivor, jehovah, loneliness, lonely, panic, purpose, storehouse, success, supreme

quote: The art of statemanship is to foresee the inevitable and to expedite its occurrence.
author: Charles Maurice de Talleyrand-Périgord

quote: How do you know it is destiny? Because it is!

quote: Fate can not be proven or disproven so act knowing that destiny is a product of your every thought and every action.

quote: Experiences might teach us to be cautious, but never to be paranoid. Paranoia is a limiter of destiny

quote: We're born with a mapped-out route. This one, not that one. Who you dream with. Who you love. It's one or the other. You choose without choosing. That's how it is. Each of us travels on their own path. Besides, how do you love someone without truly knowing who they are? How do you travel that distance when there's all that you don't know about the other?
author: Susana Fortes, Waiting for Robert Capa

quote: Romance this moment, this hour, this day. String moments together like pearls on a rope.
author: Rachelle Du Bois

quote: How can I possibly stop loving you when it's sort of predestined? — Malcom Lowry to Carol Brown, 1926 (age 16)

quote: There's folly in her stridethat's the rumorjustified by liesI've seen her up closebeneath the sheetsand sometime during the summershe was mine for a few sweet months in the falland parts of December((( To get to the heart of this unsolvable equation, one must first become familiar with the physical, emotional, and immaterial makeup as to what constitutes both war and peace. )))I found her looking through a windowthe same window I'd been looking throughShe smiled and her eyes never falteredthis folly was a crime((( The very essence of war is destructive, though throughout the years utilized as a means of creating peace, such an equation might seem paradoxical to the untrained eye. Some might say using evil to defeat evil is counterproductive, and gives more meaning to the word “futile”. Others, like Edmund Burke, would argue that “the only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men and women to do nothing.” )))She had an identity I could identify withsomething my fingertips could caress in the night((( There is such a limitless landscape within the mind, no two minds are alike. And this is why as a race we will forever be at war with each other.What constitutes peace is in the mind of the beholder. )))Have you heard the argument?This displacement of men and womenand women and menthe minds we all havethe beliefs we all shareSlipping inside of usthoughts and religions and bodiesall bare((( “Without darkness, there can be no light,”he once said. To demonstrate this theory, during one of his seminars he held a piece of white chalk and drew a line down the center of a blackboard. Explaining that without the blackness of the board, the white line would be invisible. )))When she leftshe kissed with eyes openI knew this because I'd done the sameSometimes we saw eye to eye like thatVery briefly,she considered an apotheosisa synthesisa rendering of her follyinto solidarity((( To believe that a world-wide lay down of arms is possible, however, is the delusion of the pacifist; the dream of the optimist; and the joke of the realist. Diplomacy only goes so far, and in spite of our efforts to fight with words- there are times when drawing swords of a very different nature are surely called for. )))Experiencing the subsequent sunriseinhaling and drinkingbreaking mirrors and regurgitatingjust to start againall in allI was just another gash in the bark((( Plato once said:“Only the dead have seen the end of war.” Perhaps the death of us all is called for in this time of emotional desperation. War is a product of the mind; only with the death of such will come the end of the bloodshed. Though this may be a fairly realistic view of such an issue, perhaps there is an optimistic outlook on the horizon. Not every sword is double edged, but every coin is double sided. )))Leaving town and throwing shit out the windowdrinking boroughs and borrowing spare changeI glimpsed the rear view mirrorstole a glimpse reallyI've believed in looking back for a whileit helps to have one last viewa reminder in case one ever decides to rebelin the event the self regressesand makes the declaration of devastationonce more((( Thus, if we wish to eliminate the threat of war today- complete human annihilation may be called for. )))
author: Dave Matthes, Wanderlust and the Whiskey Bottle Parallel: Poems and Stories
category: blood, booze, bravery, cynical, daydreaming, death, deep-end, denial, destiny, dreams

quote: When love feels like magic, you call it destiny. When destiny has a sense of humor, you call it serendipity.
author: Serendipity Trailer

quote: A Warrior of the Light does not waste his time listening to provocations
author: he has a destiny to fulfill.
category: Paulo Coelho, Warrior of the Light

quote: If you think you know what your purpose is, but can never seem to gain satisfaction from it, then it’s probably not the purpose you’re destined for.

category: awareness, choice, choices, destiny, epiphany, greatness, happiness, insight, life, purpose, pursuits, realization, satisfaction, searching, self-awareness, soul-searching, uncertain, uncertainty, understanding

quote: Just because someone is a keyholder, does not mean they will always help you unlock the door you want to go through – no matter how much you think you deserve to go through it. Sometimes you just have to reach out and take it.
author: A.J. Darkholme, Rise of the Morningstar
category: dependence, destiny, doors, help, independence, keyholders, others, people, potential, pursuits, reliance, take

quote: You didn't fail... You just didn't use the right method. It's neither hail nor storm... It's just a stir that precedes the settlement of your destiny. Believe that you will not remain on the ground. Wake up and try again!
author: Israelmore Ayivor, Dream Big!: See Your Bigger Picture!
category: destiny, fail, failure, food-for-thought, hail, israelmore-ayivor, method, right, right-method, settle, settlement, stand-up, storm, storms, succeed, success, try-again, wake-up

quote: If you refuse to accept what is, and choose to see what could be, then you set a course for yourself that makes others take notice of you, respect you, revere you. It is then that they become objects of your destiny instead of you playing a support role in theirs.
author: A.J. Darkholme, Rise of the Morningstar
category: acceptance, act, action, authority, choice, choices, destiny, determination, fight, improvement, influence, leader, leadership, leading, mass-influence, others, path, people, pursuits, respect, significance, status

quote: When all seems hopeless and all has gone silent, that’s Destiny turning down the music so that all may hear our response to life’s great storms, giving our response the chance to echo throughout eternity with the level of greatness it deserves.
author: A.J. Darkholme, Rise of the Morningstar
category: afterlife, character, death, destiny, eternity, greatness, hope, life, listening, music, reaction, response, silence, storms, waiting

quote: We are not slaves of the past, nor servants of the present, but masters of the future.
author: A.J. Darkholme, Rise of the Morningstar
category: acceptance, actions, choice, choices, confidence, destiny, dreams, future, gains, masters, meaning, past, perspective, potential, present, servants, significance, slaves

quote: Not accomplishing your Life Plan is a tragic act of free will. It is akin to charting an elaborate vacation itinerary before arriving at your holiday destination, with all kinds of plans for outdoor adventures and intentions to go sightseeing and shopping, but then ending up spending the whole trip in your hotel room ordering from room service and watching television. In a similar fashion the unconscious soul spends a lifetime in the semi-conscious state of Divine Disconnection and then returns home mostly ‘empty-handed’.
author: Anthon St. Maarten, Divine Living: The Essential Guide To Your True Destiny
category: awakening, awareness, consciousness, destined, destiny, determinism, divine-connection, divine-disconnect, divine-living, divine-self, free-will, god-s-plan, higher-consciousness, higher-self, life-and-death, life-and-living, life-calling, life-goals, life-journey, life-lessons, life-mission, life-philosophy, life-plan, life-purpose, life-quotes, meaning-of-life, meaninglessness-of-life, purpose-in-life, purpose-of-life, purpose-of-living, purposeful-living, reality-coma, soul, soul-purpose, spiritual, spiritual-awakening, spiritual-awareness, spiritual-growth, spiritual-insights, spiritual-life, spiritual-unconsciousness, unawakened, unconsciousness

quote: The path of destiny is not always paved smooth with gold.

quote: That’s just the way it goes when you’re going to meet your destiny. Something comes over you and it keeps your heart so stirred that nothing seems impossible… Well, except for sleep, or taking your mind off of the future." -Kearney
author: Brittany L. Engels, Kaptito Kero

quote: From the twilight of day till the twilight of evening, a leopard, in the last years of the thirteenth century, would see some wooden planks, some vertical iron bars, men and women who changed, a wall and perhaps a stone gutter filled with dry leaves. He did not know, could not know, that he longed for love and cruelty and the hot pleasure of tearing things to pieces and the wind carrying the scent of a deer, but something suffocated and rebelled within him and God spoke to him in a dream: "You live and will die in this prison so that a man I know of may see you a certain number of times and not forget you and place your figure and symbol in a poem which has its precise place in the scheme of the universe. You suffer captivity, but you will have given a word to the poem." God, in the dream, illumined the animal's brutishness and the animal understood these reasons and accepted his destiny, but, when he awoke, there was in him only an obscure resignation, a valorous ignorance, for the machinery of the world is much too complex for the simplicity of a beast.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: If you're born to be hanged you'll never be drowned.
author: Eastern European proverb

quote: We make our own destiny, not because we can see the road ahead, but because we cannot see the road ahead. It is the road, the motion, the forward movement, that takes us to ourselves.
author: Chloe Thurlow, Girl Trade

quote: Fate is cruel but maybe not random. Nature (meaning Death) always wins but that doesn't mean we have to bow and gravel to it.
author: Donna Tartt

quote: That it was no doubt a dark hour, but that he should get through it; that after all he held his destiny, evil as it might be, in his own hand; that he was master of it. He clung to that thought.
author: Victor Hugo, Les Misérables

quote: Life is how you brew it. Wake up, you have a story to tell. Don't chase vain glory, your story will tell it. You owe it to yourself to write the lines of your story in the ink of purpose!
author: Israelmore Ayivor, Dream Big!: See Your Bigger Picture!
category: brew, destiny, dreams, fame, food-for-thought, glory, israelmore-ayivor, life, purpose, story, vain, vain-glory, vanity, wake-up, write

quote: The act if living one's own destiny includes a series of stages that are far beyond our understanding, whose objective is always to... make us learn the lessons necessary to fulfill our own destiny.
author: Paulo Coelho, The Fifth Mountain

quote: Everyone basically has one aria to sing over their entire life.
author: Donna Tartt

quote: Whatever will be, will be, if and only if you let it be.
author: Ogwo David Emenike

quote: Life, here I come!' he said. And was immediately and fatally run over by a bus.
author: Jonas Jonasson, The Girl Who Saved the King of Sweden

quote: She felt the intimate loss of who she was meant to become.
author: Rabih Alameddine

quote: Matteo lived inside her like a memory that paradoxically stopped the pain and which she could never get enough of... because there was, and never would be, anything that was like him. Wherever she went, whatever she did, he was the only thing she truly loved, and which she sadly no longer had.
author: Mirella Muffarotto, Soccer Sweetheart
category: coming-of-age-love-story, destiny, fate, high-school, love, love-and-romance, love-triangles, memories, romance, teenage-love, teens, true-love, young-adult, young-love

quote: I have a spiritual journey on earth.Lord anoint and empower me to accomplish my great task on earth.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, The Alphabets of  Success: Passion Driven Life
category: anoint, anointed, anointing-fall-on-me, anointing-power, calling, calling-on-earth, calling-on-god, calling-people, destiny, destiny-and-attitude, destiny-and-chance, destiny-decides-better, destiny-fulfilled, empowered, empowered-living, empowering-quote, empowering-quotes, empowerment, faith, faith-in-yourself, faith-quotes, faith-strength, favour, fulfilling-life, fulfilling-purpose, fulfilling-your-destiny, fulfilling-your-potential, grace, grace-and-favor, grace-divine, grace-of-god, journey, journey-in-life, journey-of-life, journey-quotes, journey-to-the-end-of-the-night, life-quotes, mission, mission-quotes, mission-trip, missions, spiritual, spiritual-quotes

quote: Why do you suppose I’m here?” I asked him. Angel. A thirteen-year-old departed gangbanger. “Just ’cause you’re supposed to be, I guess.
author: Darynda Jones, First Grave on the Right

quote: When we set a goal we are fulfilling our destiny. Even if we do not reach it, we have changed our lives and the lives of others by attempting to reach it.
author: Lawren Leo, Dragonflame: Tap Into Your Reservoir of Power Using Talismans, Manifestation, and Visualization
category: change, destiny, fulfillment, goal-setting, life-lessons, philosophy-of-life

quote: Fate determines a man's beginning. The man, by choice, determines his end.
author: Ogwo David Emenike
category: choice, destiny, fate, man, ogwo-david-emenike, providence

quote: Imagination is divine. Your imagination will lead you to where you ought to be.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!
category: destiny, destiny-quotes, imagination, imagination-quotes, journey, potential-for-greatness, potential-quotes, power-of-thoughts, powerful, purpose-driven-life, travel-quotes

quote: Still there are moments when one feels free from one’s own identification with human limitations and inadequacies. At such moments, one imagines that one stands on some spot of a small planet, gazing in amazement at the cold yet profoundly moving beauty of the eternal, the unfathomable: life and death flow into one, and there is neither evolution nor destiny; only being.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Know Thyself, a wise old Greek once said. Know Thyself. Now what does this mean, boys and girls? It means, be what you are. Don't try to be Sally or Johnny or Fred next door; be yourself. God doesn't want a tree to be a waterfall, or a flower to be a stone. God gives to each one of us a special talent." Janice and Rabbit become unnaturally still; both are Christians. God's name makes them feel guilty. "God wants some of us to become scientists, some of us to become artists, some of us to become firemen and doctors and trapeze artists. And He gives to each of us the special talents to become these things, provided we work to develop them. We must work, boys and girls. So: Know Thyself. Learn to understand your talents, and then work to develop them. That's the way to be happy.
author: John Updike

quote: Minority of people are destined for success while majority succeed because they are determined for success. Where upon, work hard in silence and let success make the noise .
author: Osunsakin Adewale

quote: Mere hope isn't enough to change destiny. One must act.
author: Ogwo David Emenike
category: act, action, change, destiny, fate, future, hope

quote: James: I think people pretty much determine their fates. I think people choose their lives.Lucy: I don’t know. I think sometimes things happen to people that are beyond their control. Things that they don’t want to happen.James: I know what you’re saying. Sometimes random shit happens, but for the most part, people are where they are in life because they chose to be there.
author: Kristen Tracy

quote: Nobody, said Humboldt, had a destiny. One simply decided to feign one until one came to believe in it oneself. But so many things didn't fit in with it, one had to really force oneself.
author: Daniel Kehlmann

quote: You can slow it down but you can't change destiny.
author: Hafsa Shah

quote: Life is full of different opportunities and decisions to make, and these decisions are what mold our future and “destiny”, and the results of these decisions are a product of hard work and determination and just maybe a little bit of luck.
author: Telson Erebor

quote: So often, we think we can guess our destiny. We're so certain we know what it looks like that we forget to open ourselves up to the pleasure of surprise.
author: Melissa Hart, Wild Within: How Rescuing Owls Inspired a Family

quote: Just because others don't understand your journey doesn't mean you're not on the right one. After all, it is YOURS!
author: Michele Jennae

quote: Without knowing why or how, I found myself in love with this strange Wanderess. Maybe I was just in love with the dream she was selling me: a life of destiny and fate; as my own life up until we met had been so void of enchantment. Those things: mystery, fate, enchantment... they are things that young people offer us as soon as we get close to them. And if we're not careful, we can be seduced by, and drawn back into, the youthful world they preside over.
author: Roman Payne, The Wanderess
category: ageing, aging, desire, destiny, enchantment, fate, fountain-of-youth, roman-payne, the-wanderess, vagabond, wander, wanderer, wanderess, wandering, wanderlust, young-love, youth, youth-age, youthful, youthfulness

quote: You’re the one who has to live whit your choice" she says."Everyone else will get over it, move on, no matter what you decide. But you never will.
author: Veronica Roth, Four: A Divergent Story Collection
category: choice, choices, destiny, four, future, tari, veronica-roth

quote: The most fragile, unhappy people destine themselves to live lives of constantly reminding themselves to be happy.
author: Criss Jami, Killosophy
category: delicate, destiny, emotion, fear, fragile, happy, meaning, purpose, sensitive, unhappy, weakness

quote: Luck comes and goes; you have to seize it. Bad luck comes and goes; it must be overcome. But I will never, never sit at the side of the road showing my wounds and shouting, 'It's destiny'!
author: Jean Van Hamme, Dutch Connection
category: bad-luck, challenging, destiny, failure, good-luck, inspiration, inspirational, life, life-experiences, life-philosophy, luck, motivation, motivational, opportunities, opportunity, success

quote: We’ve been so busy with these things we let ourselves think actually mattered, but they don’t. There’s no such thing as the right career, or morality, or destiny, or fate. There’s only life. And whether you honor it or ignore it. It’s ironic, but in trying to find God we’ve been ignoring life.
author: Trevor D. Richardson, Dystopia Boy: The Unauthorized Files
category: busy, career, destiny, faith, fate, god, honor, ignore, lee-greene, life, morality, right, things, things-that-matter, wrong

quote: Until pains are endured, depressions surmounted, mockeries ignored and goliaths conquered, destiny might not be achieved
author: Ikechukwu Izuakor
category: achieve, conquer, destiny, goliath, ignore, mockery, pain

quote: And indeed if you think you're a genius at something what you achieve is very much according to your expectations; if you think you're no good, you're not going to get anywhere.
author: Diana Wynne Jones

quote: I guess there's always a price to pay when you cheat fate.
author: Sheena Hutchinson, Initiation

quote: I do not choose the roads to travel;my destination does, apparently it is always the one less traveled.
author: Pushpa Rana, Just the Way I Feel
category: adventure, aim, destination, destiny, excitement, roads, roads-less-traveled

quote: Everyone has their own path, everyone has a destiny. Your's just happens to be a little bigger than everyone else's.
author: Sheena Hutchinson, Initiation

quote: What do you mean by yuanfen?"She thought for a minute and replied, "It means: that apportionment of love which is destined for you in this world.
author: Lan Samantha Chang, Hunger

quote: Our future lies on the horizon of our destiny.
author: Robin Hubbard
category: destiny, dreaming, inspirational, jesus-christ, life, meditation, purpose, vision

quote: For those who seem to have difficulty moving forward:"Sometimes Destiny is calling but you refuse to give in to the signs because of past hurts and baggages. Sometimes the love you are searching for all this time is just right in front of you but you remain to be blind because of fear. Because of always thinking that things may not work out right instead of telling yourself that you should move forward and get happy again.Why not think instead of how beautiful something could turn out to be if you take that chance and go for it than merely let the chance pass you by again and live a life of "what ifs" along the way?You cannot label each special person you meet in this life as "the One Who Got Away". Move forward, dear one, you just don't know how special you are in someone's eyes." -Elizabeth's Quotes
author: Elizabeth E. Castillo

quote: Stories continue in all directions to include even the retelling of the stories themselves, as legend is informed by interpretation, and interpretation is informed by time. And so I tell my story to you, as the Mariner told his: he, standing outside the wedding party, snatching at a passing wrist, paralyzing his victim with his gaze; I, standing with my family at the edge of this immortal forest. I tell this story because telling this story is what I must do.
author: Garth Stein, A Sudden Light

quote: Will, is the precursor of possibility, and the foresight of potential.
author: Justin K. McFarlane Beau
category: belief, desire, destiny, faith, fate, foresight, imagination, planning, possibility, potential, predestined, will

quote: Destiny always have a choice
author: Ceejay

quote: Destiny can never be denied. It takes time to unfold .
author: Osunsakin Adewale

quote: The only thing that can destroy ur destiny is God and Yourselves!
author: Kadiri Nurudeen

quote: Fathom the destiny that, does not just lay before you - but, awaits you.
author: Eleesha, The Soulful Pathway To Inspiration: Soulfully Inspiring You to Attain Your Goals by Utilizing the Power of Inspiration
category: affirmations, channeling, destiny, destiny-and-attitude, empowerment, inspirational-quotes, motivational-quotes, quotes, soul

quote: You did not come to this world for an experiment but for an assignment written on the palm of your hand. Discover yours !
author: Osunsakin Adewale

quote: Odd, how life makes twists and turns. I never would have guessed that I’d end up where I am now, but I wouldn’t trade it for the world. I wouldn’t trade this path I’m on for the whole solar system, for that matter. If I’ve learned anything these last several months, it’s that sometimes the most scenic roads in life are the detours you didn’t mean to take.
author: Angela N. Blount, Once Upon an Ever After
category: destination, destiny, detours, journey, journey-of-life, life, life-lessons, unexpected

quote: Meeting you was fate..Becoming your friend was a choice..But falling in love with you I had no control over.
author: Teresa Conroy

quote: I had a dream about you, and in the dream you were dreaming of me. We were meant for each other subconsciously.
author: Rodney  Jenkins, Dreaming is for lovers

quote: As I drift through the autumn of my life like a fallen leaf blown about by the winds of time, I sometimes ponder my destiny.
author: Peggy Toney Horton

quote: Rejection is merely a redirection
author: a course correction to your destiny.
category: Bryant McGill, Simple Reminders: Inspiration for Living Your Best Life

quote: ...once you express your will, the Universe will conspire with each and every atom to help you reach your destiny.
author: Katy Tackes, Each Time She Wakes
category: destiny, law-of-attraction, love-quotes, metaphysical-quest, truth-inspirational, universal-mind, universal-truths

quote: There was no beginning, middle and end to destiny, it wasn't neat and manageable. It was random and scary and if it wanted to it would.
author: Lisa Jewell, Vince and Joy

quote: Don't let others control who you should be, or try to make you do what you don't want to. It will eat away at your soul. Believe it or not, you are the maker of your own destiny. You are the only one who can make choices for yourself. Even when others are doing it now, it's cause you have chosen to allow them too.
author: Lola Lola

quote: Those who don't know history are destined to be tyrannized by it
author: Dean Cavanagh

quote: There was for everything a possibility, an invisible pattern that could be made manifest given work and the right materials.
author: Kij Johnson, The Man Who Bridged the Mist

quote: You have thousands of friends and all of them will be part of your history but not with your destiny.
author: Evan

quote: Destiny is a stubborn maiden. She likes herself just the way she is.
author: Ella Leya, The Orphan Sky

quote: A moral dilemma is equally absorbing whether the stakes are the destiny of nations or the happiness of one or two people - at the most.
author: Alexander McCall Smith, A Conspiracy of Friends

quote: No man has your love at heart, they all pretend to be what they are not. They would rather write you out of relevance and reckoning than recommend you for elevation and prosperity. Your destiny is in your hands and it will take you to scribble boldly what you want the world to read about you....
author: Bayode Ojo, Petals Around The Rose

quote: Seek Truth, for it is your destiny!
author: Katy Tackes, Each Time She Wakes

quote: Determinism gives you the freedom to do whatever you like.
author: Raheel Farooq
category: destiny, determinism, fatalism, fate, free-will, predetermined-endings

quote: The greatest things that have ever happened in this world, had their genesis in the wake of special relationships of rare destiny.
author: Bryant McGill, Simple Reminders: Inspiration for Living Your Best Life
category: destiny, genesis, greatness, rarity, relationships, special

quote: There is no destination except the one inside of you.
author: Bryant McGill, Simple Reminders: Inspiration for Living Your Best Life

quote: Destiny is like a book. It needs manufacturing, the pulp process, the glue fixed tightly--and it requires a binding, to hold it together, lest it fall apart.
author: Lavie Tidhar, The Bookman

quote: The unconscious fabric of human destiny had done with her, unraveling all her grievances and reweaving them as joyous circumstance.
author: Michelle Franklin, Recollection of Shared Days: Stories of Celebration

quote: I write letters to you that you’ll never see.
author: Jennifer Elisabeth
category: anxiety, art, beach, born-ready, cape-cod, coming-of-age, constellations, depression, destiny, fate, friends, girls, growing, growing-up, healing, hope, inspiration, jennifer-elisabeth, learning, letters, life, love, love-letters, lovers, mail, ocean, pray, prayer, red-thread, red-thread-of-destiny, red-thread-of-fate, self-acceptance, self-love, self-reflection, soul, soul-mates, stars, teenagers, teens, time, universe, wish

quote: He looked at me, that first day, like he had just found something he’d lost a thousand years ago.
author: Jennifer Elisabeth
category: anxiety, art, beach, born-ready, cape-cod, coming-of-age, constellations, depression, destiny, fate, friends, girls, growing, growing-up, healing, hope, inspiration, jennifer-elisabeth, learning, life, love, lovers, nostalgia, ocean, pray, prayer, red-thread, red-thread-of-destiny, red-thread-of-fate, self-acceptance, self-love, self-reflection, soul, soul-mates, stars, teenagers, teens, time, universe, wish

quote: Destiny. To believe that a life is meant for a single purpose, one must also believe in a common fate. Father to daughter, brother to sister, mother to child. Blood ties can be as unyielding as they are eternal. But it is our bonds of choice that truly light the road we travel. Love versus hatred. Loyalty against betrayal. A person's true destiny can only be revealed at the end of his journey, and the story I have to tell is far from over.
author: Emily Thorne
category: betrayal, blood, choice, destiny, eternal, fate, hatred, journey, life, love, loyalty, purpose, revenge, revenge-tv-series, story

quote: But I love you and I want you and I need you. Can’t you see that? This world has nothing to offer me if it doesn’t include you.
author: Jennifer Elisabeth
category: anxiety, art, beach, born-ready, cape-cod, coming-of-age, constellations, depression, destiny, fate, friends, girls, growing, growing-up, healing, hope, inspiration, jennifer-elisabeth, learning, life, love, lovers, need, ocean, pray, prayer, red-thread, red-thread-of-destiny, red-thread-of-fate, self-acceptance, self-love, self-reflection, soul, soul-mates, stars, teenagers, teens, time, universe, want, wish, world

quote: The Fall will always be yours and mine…
author: Jennifer Elisabeth
category: anxiety, art, autumn, beach, born-ready, cape-cod, coming-of-age, constellations, depression, destiny, fall, fate, friends, girls, growing, growing-up, healing, hope, inspiration, jennifer-elisabeth, learning, life, love, lovers, ocean, pray, prayer, red-thread, red-thread-of-destiny, red-thread-of-fate, self-acceptance, self-love, self-reflection, soul, soul-mates, stars, teenagers, teens, time, universe, wish

quote: If he couldn't forgive you for what you'd done, it was clear to me he was never truly your destiny.
author: Arthur Golden, Memoirs of a Geisha

quote: Time' is the most threatening four letter word.
author: Jennifer Elisabeth
category: anxiety, art, beach, born-ready, cape-cod, coming-of-age, constellations, depression, destiny, fate, friends, girls, growing, growing-up, healing, hope, inspiration, jennifer-elisabeth, learning, life, love, lovers, ocean, pray, prayer, red-thread, red-thread-of-destiny, red-thread-of-fate, self-acceptance, self-love, self-reflection, soul, soul-mates, stars, teenagers, teens, time, universe, wish

quote: Some say that to believe in destiny is to dismiss the role of free will. That self-determination cannot prevail in the presence of fate. When the truth is, the only part of destiny we can control is the fate we choose for another.
author: Emily Thorne
category: control, destiny, fate, free-will, revenge, revenge-tv-series, self-determination

quote: I’m tired of justifying why I love someone. I’m done with the explaining.
author: Jennifer Elisabeth
category: anxiety, art, beach, born-ready, cape-cod, coming-of-age, constellations, depression, destiny, explaining, fate, friends, girls, growing, growing-up, healing, hope, inspiration, jennifer-elisabeth, learning, life, love, lovers, ocean, pray, prayer, red-thread, red-thread-of-destiny, red-thread-of-fate, self-acceptance, self-love, self-reflection, soul, soul-mates, stars, teenagers, teens, time, universe, wish

quote: You didn't judge my past. That's when I knew I couldn't turn away from you even if I tried...
author: E.L. Montes, Perfectly Damaged
category: batsa, beautiful, contemporary-romance, destiny, el-montes, faith, favorite-book, favorite-lines, favorite-quotes, jenna, logan, lost, love, love-story, must-read, perfection, perfectly-damage, sacrifice

quote: That last time you kissed me my heart slid past your teeth down into the center of your chest… trapping us both in a stainless cage.
author: Jennifer Elisabeth
category: anxiety, art, beach, born-ready, cage, cape-cod, chest, coming-of-age, constellations, depression, destiny, fate, friends, girls, growing, growing-up, healing, hope, inspiration, jennifer-elisabeth, kiss, learning, life, love, lovers, mouth, ocean, pray, prayer, red-thread, red-thread-of-destiny, red-thread-of-fate, self-acceptance, self-love, self-reflection, soul, soul-mates, stars, teenagers, teens, teeth, time, universe, wish

quote: If I had an .MP3 of your heartbeat… I might actually get some sleep.
author: Jennifer Elisabeth
category: anxiety, art, beach, born-ready, cape-cod, coming-of-age, constellations, depression, destiny, fate, friends, girls, growing, growing-up, healing, heart-beat, hope, inspiration, jennifer-elisabeth, learning, life, love, lovers, mp3, ocean, pray, prayer, red-thread, red-thread-of-destiny, red-thread-of-fate, self-acceptance, self-love, self-reflection, sleep, soul, soul-mates, stars, teenagers, teens, time, universe, wish

quote: The morning I drove by and saw you alone, staring at the house. I told myself to keep on driving, but something told me to stop. And when I'd seen how lost and confused you were, something told me I was meant to be there....I was meant to be there so I could help you find your way
author: E.L. Montes, Perfectly Damaged
category: batsa, beautiful, contemporary-romance, destiny, el-montes, faith, favorite-book, favorite-lines, favorite-quotes, jenna, logan, lost, love, love-story, must-read, perfection, perfectly-damage, sacrifice

quote: What do you think destiny is? A smooth path that never jostles you? No. When you walk in your destiny, you will crash and fall more times than you can count. But the secret is to hold on to God’s vision for your life — and for the lives of those He puts under your charge. No matter how many times you fall, crash, and fail, you get up. You get up and face your obstacles.
author: Tessa Afshar, Harvest of Gold
category: christian, christianity, destiny, faith, god, inspirational, life-lessons, wisdom

quote: Somewhere out there, a higherform of sadism won the first round.Well, screw that. I'm not ready to bepwned.
author: Clyde DeSouza, Memories With Maya
category: artificial-intelligence, destiny, fate, free-will, god-s-will, humanity, posthumanism, sadism, transhumanism

quote: There is no chance, no fate, no destiny that can circumvent, or hinder, or control the firm resolve of a determined soul.
author: Hyrum Smith

quote: I kept waiting for the part where I’d finally know who I was — some flashing, neon moment of relief, but it never came.
author: Jennifer Elisabeth
category: anxiety, art, beach, born-ready, cape-cod, coming-of-age, constellations, depression, destiny, fate, friends, girls, growing, growing-up, healing, hope, identity, inspiration, jennifer-elisabeth, learning, life, love, lovers, ocean, pray, prayer, red-thread, red-thread-of-destiny, red-thread-of-fate, self-acceptance, self-love, self-reflection, soul, soul-mates, stars, teenagers, teens, time, universe, wish

quote: Apparently, the princes had found the only four women in the universes who didn’t dream of being royal, rich and adored by their husbands.
author: Michelle M. Pillow, The Perfect Prince

quote: The Christian Journey is not just to a place "Heaven", it is also to a person "Jesus". Ephesians 4:13 says "Till we all come to the measure of the stature of the fullness of Christ
author: Kingsley Opuwari Manuel
category: character, christ, christian, christian-journey, christian-living, destiny, faith-based, glory, god, heaven, heaven-and-hell, inspirational, powerful, prayer, purpose, religious, service-help-blessings, spiritual

quote: No... we're not playing God. We're only attempting to set things right.
author: Clyde DeSouza, Memories With Maya
category: artificial-intelligence, destiny, fate, god-s-plan, god-s-will, transhumanism

quote: Some people are agents from birth, Monsignors -- he told them -- appointed to the work by the period of history, the place, and their own natural dispositions. In their cases, it was simply a question of who got to them first, Your Eminences: 'Whether it's us, whether it's the opposition, or whether it's the bloody missionaries.
author: John le Carré, The Honourable Schoolboy

quote: Sweep my dreams not beneath my feet. Be somewhere that my steps won't meet. Breaking the broom isn't a must. Don't mistake unmoved dreams for dust
author: Isaiah J. Lawrence
category: date, desire, destiny, dreams, fortune, hells-clouds, hope, inspirational, isaiah, isaiah-j-lawrence, isaiah-lawrence, luck, lucky-ashes, mistake, motivating, poetry, promise, romance, stories, sweep, words, writing

quote: Somewhere out there, a higherform of sadism, won the first round.Well, screw that. I'm not ready to bepwned.
author: Clyde DeSouza, Memories With Maya
category: artificial-intelligence, destiny, fate, god, loss, loss-of-faith

quote: We are built to desire free will and to choose our own destiny. It's not about being right or wrong; it's about the celebration of life, your free will. The human spirit must constantly be fed. It is what makes us survive.
author: DeiAmor Verus

quote: Don’t try to present your art by making other people read or hear or see or touch it; make them feel it. Wear your art like your heart on your sleeve and keep it alive by making people feel a little better. Feel a little lighter. Create art in order for yourself to become yourselfand let your very existence be your song, your poem, your story.Let your very identity be your book.Let the way people say your name sound like the sweetest melody.
author: Charlotte Eriksson
category: acting, appearance, artist, being-an-artist, books, charlotte-eriksson, creating, creativity, dancer, destiny, diary, existence, experience, fame, fate, forget, growing-up, holy, how-to-live, identity, infinite, legacy, life, life-story, lit, lit-quote, literature-quote, love, magic, melody, music, mystery, never-forgotten, photography, poetry, prose, rain, read, remembered, singing, songwriter, songwriting, stars, story, the-glass-child, tumblr-writer, writer, writing

quote: In the old days, when travelers would get lost, they would follow the stars and I love that idea. I wish that I could rely on something as simple and magnificent as a star for all of my aching questions.
author: Jennifer Elisabeth, Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
category: anxiety, art, beach, born-ready, cape-cod, coming-of-age, constellations, depression, destiny, fate, friends, girls, growing, growing-up, healing, hope, inspiration, jennifer-elisabeth, learning, life, love, lovers, ocean, pray, prayer, red-thread, red-thread-of-destiny, red-thread-of-fate, self-acceptance, self-love, self-reflection, soul, soul-mates, stars, teenagers, teens, time, universe, wish

quote: I ruin everything. I think that a bullet must have passed through my heart when I was very young, causing me to bleed out slowly, over things and people and every white surface that I’d ever come across.
author: Jennifer Elisabeth, Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
category: anxiety, art, beach, born-ready, cape-cod, coming-of-age, constellations, depression, destiny, fate, friends, girls, growing, growing-up, healing, hope, inspiration, jennifer-elisabeth, learning, life, love, lovers, ocean, pray, prayer, red-thread, red-thread-of-destiny, red-thread-of-fate, self-acceptance, self-love, self-reflection, soul, soul-mates, stars, teenagers, teens, time, universe, wish

quote: I wish that love could be broken down the way it breaks me down.
author: Jennifer Elisabeth
category: anxiety, art, beach, born-ready, cape-cod, coming-of-age, constellations, depression, destiny, fate, friends, girls, growing, growing-up, healing, heart-break, hope, inspiration, jennifer-elisabeth, learning, life, love, lovers, ocean, pray, prayer, red-thread, red-thread-of-destiny, red-thread-of-fate, self-acceptance, self-love, self-reflection, soul, soul-mates, stars, teenagers, teens, time, universe, wish

quote: I don’t ever want to hurt anyone, but I really wish there was something like a reset button on my life.
author: Jennifer Elisabeth, Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
category: anxiety, art, beach, born-ready, cape-cod, coming-of-age, constellations, depression, destiny, fate, friends, girls, growing, growing-up, healing, hope, inspiration, jennifer-elisabeth, learning, life, love, lovers, ocean, pray, prayer, red-thread, red-thread-of-destiny, red-thread-of-fate, self-acceptance, self-love, self-reflection, soul, soul-mates, stars, teenagers, teens, time, universe, wish

quote: A powerful thing, destiny. You can't run from it. Not in the end.
author: Richard C. Morais, The Hundred-Foot Journey

quote: He could pour himself into my little paper cup heart and my emptiness would finally have a meaning.
author: Jennifer Elisabeth, Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
category: anxiety, art, beach, born-ready, cape-cod, coming-of-age, constellations, depression, destiny, fate, friends, girls, growing, growing-up, healing, hope, inspiration, jennifer-elisabeth, learning, life, love, lovers, ocean, pray, prayer, red-thread, red-thread-of-destiny, red-thread-of-fate, self-acceptance, self-love, self-reflection, soul, soul-mates, stars, teenagers, teens, time, universe, wish

quote: It feels like the world is folding up around me, like origami paper, and I’m trapped inside of its breathless center.
author: Jennifer Elisabeth, Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
category: anxiety, art, beach, born-ready, cape-cod, coming-of-age, constellations, depression, destiny, fate, friends, girls, growing, growing-up, hope, inspiration, jennifer-elisabeth, learning, life, love, lovers, ocean, pray, prayer, red-thread, red-thread-of-destiny, red-thread-of-fate, self-acceptance, self-love, self-reflection, soul, soul-mates, stars, teenagers, teens, universe, wish

quote: But destiny is a very peculiar thing, with a complex timing that is impossible to comprehend.
author: Diana Lanham, House of Aegea

quote: I want to understand the strings that are tied between me and certain other people and if they really can stretch through infinite time and space without ever breaking. Are soul mates real, and is my life ever going to make sense?
author: Jennifer Elisabeth
category: anxiety, art, beach, born-ready, cape-cod, coming-of-age, constellations, depression, destiny, fate, friends, girls, growing, growing-up, hope, inspiration, jennifer-elisabeth, learning, life, love, lovers, ocean, pray, prayer, red-thread, red-thread-of-destiny, red-thread-of-fate, self-acceptance, self-love, self-reflection, soul, soul-mates, stars, teenagers, teens, universe, wish

quote: I feel like a paper cut just waiting to bleed.
author: Jennifer Elisabeth, Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
category: anxiety, art, beach, born-ready, cape-cod, coming-of-age, constellations, depression, destiny, fate, friends, girls, growing, growing-up, hope, inspiration, jennifer-elisabeth, learning, life, love, lovers, ocean, pray, prayer, red-thread, red-thread-of-destiny, red-thread-of-fate, self-acceptance, self-love, self-reflection, soul, soul-mates, stars, teenagers, teens, time, universe, wish

quote: There are many futures, not just one. Life is not like walking down the road and meeting the predetermined events.
author: Akemi G, Why We Are Born: Remembering Our Purpose through the Akashic Records

quote: I wish on one of the stars for divine orchestration and save the rest of them for all of the other girls in the world who will feel like I do tonight.
author: Jennifer Elisabeth, Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
category: anxiety, art, beach, born-ready, cape-cod, coming-of-age, constellations, depression, destiny, fate, friends, girls, growing, growing-up, healing, hope, inspiration, jennifer-elisabeth, learning, life, love, lovers, ocean, pray, prayer, red-thread, red-thread-of-destiny, red-thread-of-fate, self-acceptance, self-love, self-reflection, soul, soul-mates, stars, teenagers, teens, time, universe, wish

quote: It’s almost as if we don’t need to live our lives or feel our feelings at all, because someone already told us what the ending was going to be.
author: Josephine Angelini, Starcrossed

quote: The willingness to challenge hardships taps the power within human beings to transform even a place of tragedy into a stage for fulfilling one's mission.
author: Daisaku Ikeda
category: buddhism, challenge-inspiration-motivation, destiny, hardship-overcome, inspirational, potential-for-greatness

quote: Standing naked on the beach with all of my secrets between my legs, I look out into the water and up deep into the stars. I beg the sparkling lanterns of light to cure me of myself…
author: Jennifer Elisabeth, Born Ready: Unleash Your Inner Dream Girl
category: anxiety, art, beach, born-ready, cape-cod, coming-of-age, constellations, depression, destiny, fate, friends, girls, growing, growing-up, healing, hope, inspiration, jennifer-elisabeth, learning, life, love, lovers, ocean, pray, prayer, red-thread, red-thread-of-destiny, red-thread-of-fate, self-acceptance, self-love, self-reflection, soul, soul-mates, stars, teenagers, teens, time, universe, wish

quote: We watch the sky, we watch it alive and we watch it die, looking for signs. We live like wind, with hope in wings that we will get there, never sooner or never later, but at a right time.
author: Anthony Liccione
category: alive, changing, destiny, die, goals, patience, seasons, signs, sky, timing, waiting, wings

quote: Dark rumblings inside told him he was in a tremendous amount of trouble. He didn't know how it was going to manifest or when but it was coming, sure as Zeta would break the horizon before everyone else arose from their sleepzone. If they hauled him away, then what?
author: Marcha A. Fox, Beyond the Hidden Sky
category: beyond-the-hidden-sky, destiny, fate, intuition, laren-brightstar, premonitions

quote: Love, the strongest and deepest element in all life, the harbinger of hope, of joy, of ecstasy; love, the defier of all laws, of all conventions; love, the freest, the most powerful moulder of human destiny; how can such an all-compelling force be synonymous with that poor little State and Church-begotten weed, marriage?love,
author: Emma Goldman, Anarchism and Other Essays

quote: I know genes are a big deal, son, but they're not the be-all and end-all." Rob slowed to a halt at the lights, wishing the dickhead behind would back off. "If they were, you'd be in a seafood salad and I'd be in prison.
author: Karen Traviss, Going Grey

quote: Your problem is that you’re more like an empty book and you’re waiting on someone else to write your pages for you. For someone who doesn’t believe in fate, destiny and all that shit, you seem to spend an awful lot of time waiting for something to happen to you.
author: Garry Crystal, Leaving London

quote: I think that the things that are supposed to happen stay inside you...even if they cannot be, they fight to get out of you. Even if the adversities of life keep you imprisoned, making your destiny seem impossible...you still feel it. There has to be a place, somewhere, even in dreams... where the things that are supposed to happen...happen.
author: Chelsie Shock, Rogue

quote: I believe that life is written out for you, it maps out your life to make you happy, but what I’ve been living for the past four years is my unwritten life...
author: Amy Shannon, Unwritten Life

quote: His failure became my destiny
author: Aporva Kala, Life... Love... Kumbh...

quote: We're not reinventing the wheel. We're just rolling it down our own path.
author: D.R. Pedraza, The Solomon Chronicles (Book  II )- Revisions

quote: When fate connects an invisible thread between a man and a woman who are bound to be together, no matter how hard they try to fight against their own destiny, they can’t change what’s meant to be.
author: Nino Varsimashvili

quote: I still think that everyone's life, no matter how unremarkable, has a singular tragic encounter after which everything that really matters will happen. That moment is the catalyst - the first step in the equation. But knowing the first step will get you nowhere - it's what comes after that determines the result.
author: Robyn Schneider, The Beginning of Everything

quote: Most people trusted in the future, assuming that their preferred version of it would unfold.
author: Jhumpa Lahiri, The Lowland

quote: Any creature, even one as unassuming as a fish, can become something mighty. When they courageously endure their trials, they meet their destiny.
author: Colleen Houck, Tiger's Promise

quote: Throughout the ancient world, naming was a sacred act. It was the word by which a child was called into his calling. It was the voice of destiny, summoning the child into his future with all its glorious promise.
author: Anne   Hamilton, God's Panoply: The Armour of God and the Kiss of Heaven

quote: You're not the one Teach!!The man roger was waiting for,at the very least,it's not you teachJust as there are people who inherited roger's will...Someday one will carry ace's will...You may eradicate their bloodline ,but their flame never dies...For many ages , it has been passed down through the generations...And someday,bearing the weight of all these generations,a man will appear to challenge this world...Sengoku,you people of the World Government are living in fear of that great battle that will someday engulf the entire world...Though it has nothing to do with me... When somebody finds that treasure... The world will be turned upside down!!...OH yes!it will be found!That day will come!!!!ONE PIECE!IS OUT THERE!!!!!!
author: Whitebeard

quote: A life path may have strange twists and turnings, and we do not always end up where we intend to go....
author: Marion Zimmer Bradley, The Forest House

quote: since destiny always rings three times...
author: Muriel Barbery, The Elegance of the Hedgehog

quote: So you believe in fate,” I say.Dr. Mann pauses thoughtfully before answering. “I believe each of us was uniquely created for a specific purpose designed by the Creator, and that, because of that, there are certain things in our lives that we are destined by Him to do. The rest, I think, is soft clay: left entirely to the defining influences of choice, chance, and circumstance. And luck! Don’t forget luck.
author: Lauren Miller, Parallel
category: chance, choice, circumstance, destiny, faith, purpose

quote: No price is too high to pay, to be the author of your fate.
author: Johnathan Jena
category: choice, destiny, fate, life, payment, price, sacrifice, writing

quote: Explore your untamed dreams and you just might find a unique place where a confluence of paths lead towards your destiny.
author: Kathy Goodhew, Confluence

quote: A great human revolution in just a single individual will help achieve a change in the destiny of a nation, and further, can even enable a change in the destiny of all humankind.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: ...Mr. Hardie had little patience with that sort of conversation."Ye're born, ye suffer, and ye die. What made ye think ye deserved different?" he wondered aloud when the deacon's gentle answers failed to quiet them.
author: Charlotte Rogan, The Lifeboat

quote: The pain and the sadness that you encounter when you lose something important is only a mix of one emotion: guilt. When you feel it once, you learn from it. When you live it twice, you mourn in silence. But if you experience it thrice, you will break, shattering like a frail piece of glass. But if you manage to survive, then you will only be a shadow of your soul: a broken doll. Because we are nothing more than mere puppets of Destiny, holding tightly on the string that keeps us from being consumed by the darkness. The string that will eventually lead humankind to its pinnacle.A simple red string named Hope.
author: Giou Yomi

quote: You become a hypocrite when you can't freely be at peace with others, but you can carry green palm leaves to church to commemorate "palm Sunday"! Throw those palm leaves somewhere; and lay your life down for someone to walk on and get to the destined land!
author: Israelmore Ayivor, The Great Hand Book of Quotes
category: accommodate, accommodate-people, at-peace-with-all, commemorate, destiny, easter, easter-quotes, food-for-thought, free, freely, green-palm-leaves, hypocrite, israelmore-ayivor, lay-your-life, leaves, mentor, palm, palm-leaves, palm-sunday, peace, peace-and-unity, throw, walk

quote: Life's situations are like a set of cards in your hands.You cannot change the cards, but you can surely play with them in your own unique way.
author: Manoj Arora, From the Rat Race to Financial Freedom

quote: Destiny is a matter of chance and choice.
author: Mark Verndick

quote: Never underrate your confession. Destiny transformation begins when you begin to make positive confession about yourself
author: Benjamin Suulola

quote: Destiny can sometimes be history coming back to bite you in the arse.
author: Hal Duncan, Scruffians! Stories of Better Sodomites

quote: Now that this destiny was about to happen, every instinct within him fought against it, realizing he had been fetishizing suicide.
author: Thomm Quackenbush, Danse Macabre (Night's Dream, #2)

quote: Life is what happen when you wake up to its reality
author: Benjamin Suulola

quote: The way two people can and everything place, find each other in a crowd, and change your life the lives of the people around them forever... It makes you believe in fate. In fate love some extra authority. Some destined significance." Wow, very powerful.
author: Deb Caletti, Stay

quote: Uninformed, America may succumb to bad ideas and leaders. In succumbing, we fail to fulfill our destiny. Well informed, America rises as far as the good ideas and leaders it proactively chooses. In so rising, we fulfill our destiny and offer to the world vacuum its last best hope. (Scott L. Vanatter)
author: Scott L. Vanatter

quote: Everyone wears masks.They come in all different shapes and sizes.The only problem with trying one on is that it fits. How easily we fall into the trap that we don’t have to be who we really are.How easily we convince ourselves that we need to cover up what we were born to be.It’s a tragedy that fear keeps us from our destiny.It’s hell when the person you were created to be is covered up by some cheap imposter
author: Rachel Van Dyken, Toxic
category: destiny, different, imposters, mask, reason, size, tragedy

quote: The tragedy of the man not set up for tragedy—that is every man's tragedy.
author: Philip Roth, American Pastoral

quote: When Fortune knocks, open the door,' they say. But why should one make fortune knock, by keeping the door shut?
author: Idries Shah, Caravan of Dreams
category: destiny, fate, fortune, luck, sufi, sufis, sufism

quote: Those things: Mystery, Fate, and Enchantment... they are things that young people offer us as soon as we get close to them. And if we’re not careful, we can be seduced by, and drawn back into, the youthful world the young preside over.
author: Roman Payne, The Wanderess

quote: What you choose today will determine who you are tomorrow.
author: Tim Fargo
category: choices, choose, consequences, course, decide, decisions, destiny, determine, determines, fate, path, path-of-life, trajectory

quote: I do believe—that all the world's a star. Beyond that heav'nly light I shall fly far!" Luke (ACT I, Scene 7)
author: Ian Doescher, William Shakespeare's Star Wars: Verily, A New Hope

quote: But, Mameha-san, I don’t want kindness!”“Don’t you? I thought we all wanted kindness. Perhaps what you mean is that you want something more than kindness. And that is something you’re in no position to ask.
author: Arthur Golden, Memoirs of a Geisha

quote: that droplet of moisture that had slipped from me like a tear seemed almost to tell the story of my life. It fell through empty space, with no control whatsoever over its destiny; rolled along a path of silk; and somehow came to rest there on the teeth of that dragon. I thought of the petals I’d thrown into the Kamo River shallows outside Mr. Arashino’s workshop, imagining they might find their way to the Chairman. It seemed to me that, somehow, perhaps they had.
author: Arthur Golden, Memoirs of a Geisha

quote: The dance had distilled her and she had become one with the essence of all that is.
author: Holly Lynn Payne, DAMASCENA - The Tale of Roses and Rumi
category: dance, destiny, essence-of-life, one-with-the-universe, rumi, sufi

quote: Façade. One, simple word. But, very complex portents. It’s like living a life of half-dead. You are neither fully inside a grave, nor completely out of it, beyond the oppressive calmness of the slabs, tombstones and plaques. There is one solace though, you soon discover that you are not alone in the vast graveyard of the half-dead. This is what Kamini soon realized when she plunged herself back into the world that the destiny had conspired her to inherit.
author: Vinod Pande, Don's wife
category: death-and-love, destiny, facade, grave, half-dead, sombre

quote: In Poems of Love and Light: The Light of The Sun…Our Breath as One, the tenor seems to have changed slightly, as the progression of Love and lovers is, in many cases (if not all) quixotic, dependent upon mutual understanding, the conditions of the moment, the awareness of the future, as well as the mundane life, in which we all must exist, embracing real life, as is the natural state, which sentient individuals traverse – illusion may help those in the ‘moment’, but does nothing for the long-term, except misdirect it.Poetry has always been a way to leave something for those who come after, a legacy of inspiration, methodology, spirit, love, emotion, historical sense and utility, depending upon the subject matter, intentions of the bard, and the situations, which frame the creation of that sense of experience, with which the Poet receives his Muse. Poems of Love and Light: In The Light of the Sun, Our Breath as One
author: Frank L. DeSilva
category: all-ways, destiny, lovers, muse, poems-of-love-and-light, tales-of-love-and-light, transcendence

quote: Human freedom brings with it the burden of choice and of its consequences. As humankind is akin to claim for its own special privilege a certain unique destiny not afforded with equal measure to other organisms, so must it further—if paradoxically so—entertain the assumption that, in spite of this glorious determinism, there persists nonetheless a thread of free will—or, at the very least, some vague delusion thereof—woven seamlessly into the tapestry of collective experience. Of course, this conception that destiny is to be forged by one’s own hands more often engenders greater restriction than it does greater extension to the potential of human happiness.
author: Ashim Shanker, Sinew of the Social Species
category: burden-of-choice, choice-and-attitude, choices-and-consequences, destiny, determinism, existentialism, free-will-quotes, happiness-choices, human-arrogance, human-freedom, human-potential, paradox, tapestry

quote: Be willing to turn your attention to that which serves you.
author: Holly Lynn Payne, DAMASCENA - The Tale of Roses and Rumi
category: attention, coming-of-age, destiny, rumi, serve, understanding

quote: The word "frustration" is defined as the unfortunate tendency of lessening one's destiny. Rise up and take all frustrations away! Stop squeezing your dreams into a small size... You were not created to settle for less!
author: Israelmore Ayivor, The Great Hand Book of Quotes
category: achieve, condemn, define, destiny, don-t-settle-for-less, failing, failure, food-for-thought, frustrate, frustrated, frustrates, frustration, grow-up, israelmore-ayivor, less, lessen, lessening, rise, settle, size, small, small-size, squeeze, stop-condemning-yourself, success, successful, tendency, unfortunate, unfortunately, up, wise-up, word

quote: Prior preparation is Success divided by half. Once you have fully prepared, every hand glove that obstacles wear to pull you away from reaching your destination will become slippery!
author: Israelmore Ayivor, The Great Hand Book of Quotes
category: a-pair-of-gloves, accomplish, accomplishments, achieve, away, barriers, destination, destined, destiny, extra-mile, food-for-thought, full-preparation, fully-prepared, glove, hand, hand-glove, israelmore-ayivor, obstacles, preparation, prepared, prepared-mind, preparedness, prior, prior-preparation, pull, reach, reachcing, slippery, success, success-formula, successful, wear, win-your-race, winner

quote: People are raised to believe that happiness is the land to which they are destined to travel. But that belief, which one so easily accepts as true, might just as well be a mirage.
author: Pramoedya Ananta Toer, The Mute's Soliloquy: a Memoir
category: acceptance, belief, destiny, happiness, indonesia, irony, mirage, travel, true

quote: Once we’ve savored the goodness of a hundred years until the final drop, only the fleeting memories of intoxication is left behind. Between you and me is it too much to ask for a bottle to begin with?
author: Xue Yun
category: destiny, fate, love, love-quotes, lovers, relationships

quote: You must understand that love never keeps a man from pursuing his destiny. If he abandons that pursuit, it's because it wasn't true love… the love that speaks the Language of the World.
author: Paulo Coelho, The Alchemist

quote: We were not destined to survive. The fact is, we were not destined at all. The war would take what it could get.
author: Kevin Powers, The Yellow Birds

quote: Your destiny lies in your own hands. But remember it was God who deposited it there!
author: Israelmore Ayivor, The Great Hand Book of Quotes
category: commandments, creator, deposit, destiny, food-for-thought, god, hand, hands, israelmore-ayivor, jehovah, life, obey-god, pride, vision, your-destiny

quote: We are pushed towards eternal silence from the moment we are born. So when sadness tries to stifle us, we must not give in. We must keep whispering.
author: Shaun Hick
category: destiny, hold-on, inspirational, keep-fighting, keepwhispering, life, never-give-up, shaun-hick, silence

quote: Decision is the wing that makes dreams to go and grow and flow and fly. No decision, no fulfilled destiny!
author: Israelmore Ayivor, The Great Hand Book of Quotes
category: big-dreams, choice, choose, decide, decide-to-be, decision, destination, destiny, dream-big, dreams, flight, flow, flow-and-fly, fly, food-for-thought, fulfilled, fulfillment, go, go-and-grow, grow, israelmore-ayivor, make-a-choice, plan, purpose, wing

quote: There was no thunderbolt, no quickening of the heart, but there was a sense of recognition.A familiarity about his face..
author: Judith Kinghorn, The Last Summer

quote: Call your destiny. Put in your work. Manifest your blessings.
author: Alafia Stewart

quote: What I believe is that when it comes to big things in life, there are no accidents. Everything happens for a reason. You are here for a reason -- and it's not to fail and die.
author: Ransom Riggs, Hollow City

quote: I was doing that thing the infatuated do, stitching destiny onto the person we want stitched to us.
author: Rachel Kushner, The Flamethrowers

quote: My life will end someday, but it will end at my convenience.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
category: burial, control, death, decision, departure, destiny, end-of-life, epitaph, final-day, funeral, ghost, giving-up, grave, graveyard, karma, karmic, michael-bassey-johnson, mortal, mortality, obsequies, rest-in-peace, sickness, six-feet, spirituality, tomb, tombstone

quote: If you lead me astray, then my wanderings will bring me to my destination.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
category: astray, believe-in-yourself, conviction, darkness, destination, destiny, deviation, divine-comedy, estimation, faith, fate, haven, hidden, journey, leaders, learning, mentality, michael-bassey-johnson, random-thoughts, recuperation, relying-in-god, repentance, restoration, salvation, scold, scolding, self-reliance, spiritual-growth, spiritual-journey, thoughts, toture, truth, uncover, wander, wandering, wanderings

quote: It isn't about knowing the most stories, child. It is about carrying the ones that are most important and passing them along.
author: Ishmael Beah, Radiance of Tomorrow

quote: The world is a classroom - life is the teacher and the subjects are learned everyday from the successes, failures, changes twists, turns, surprises and contradictions - some brought about through choices and others pre-ordained by destiny.
author: Eugenie Laverne Mitchell

quote: None of us really know what we’re doing,” Dia replied. “We just go out there and do it and have faith it’ll turn out okay.
author: J.M. Darhower, Sempre: Redemption

quote: You can't change where you come from, but you can change where you go from here. Just like a book. If you don't like the ending, you can make up a new one.
author: Sarah Addison Allen, Lost Lake
category: change, destiny, hope, outlook, perspective, the-future

quote: That felt strange. How sharp a rent a handful of moments made in the fabric of a life.
author: Guy Gavriel Kay

quote: I believe in transhumanism: once there are enough people who can truly say that, the human species will be on the threshold of a new kind of existence, as different from ours as ours is from that of Peking man. It will at last be consciously fulfilling its real destiny.
author: Julian Huxley, New Bottles For New Wine
category: destiny, evolution, existence, future, peking-man, transhumanism

quote: I dream of a morning when Filipinos can wake up from the centuries-long sleep that took them from their past and denied them their destiny as a people.
author: Psyche Roxas-Mendoza
category: centuries, destiny, dream, filipinos, morning, past, people, sleep, wake-up

quote: . . . the mysteries, on belief in which theology would hang the destinies of mankind, are cunningly devised fables whose origin and growth are traceable to the age of Ignorance, the mother of credulity.
author: Edward Clodd
